item.title: PM Modi Motivates Youth To Take Ownership Of 'Viksit Bharat', Warns Against 'Chalta Hai' Attitude - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Motivates Youth To Take Ownership Of 'Viksit Bharat', Warns Against 'Chalta Hai' Attitude

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized the need for Indian youth to take ownership of the 'Viksit Bharat' initiative during the Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue 2025. He expressed confidence that India’s youth could help elevate the nation to developed status by 2047.

  • Modi urged young people to reject the 'chalta hai' attitude and strive for significant changes in the country.
  • He highlighted the importance of setting and achieving ambitious goals, stating that it is a collective responsibility of all citizens.
  • He recalled Swami Vivekananda’s faith in the youth, asserting that today's youth are pivotal in solving the nation's challenges.
  • Modi mentioned a young athlete’s nickname for him as 'Param Mitra', emphasizing the trust and connection with the youth.
  • The Prime Minister affirmed that with unified efforts, no power can stop India's progress.
“Setting and achieving big goals is not just the work of any one government machinery; it is a must that every citizen of the country joins it...” - PM Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi's message aims to inspire the younger generation to actively participate in the nation’s development journey towards becoming a fully developed country by the year 2047.

item.title: Bangladesh summons Indian envoy over border tensions - The Indian Express
item.description:
Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy Over Border Tensions

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Indian Express

Bangladesh expressed its concerns to India regarding border security and recent actions by the Border Security Force (BSF) that have escalated tensions along the Indo-Bangla border.

  • Bangladesh summoned Indian High Commissioner Pranay Verma to discuss border tensions.
  • Allegations were made that India attempted to construct fences at five locations along the border.
  • The Indian envoy emphasized cooperation between BSF and Bangladesh's Border Guard.
  • Recent incidents, including a citizen's killing by BSF, heightened concerns.
  • Bangladesh aims to resolve issues through dialogue rather than conflict.
“Unauthorized attempts to construct fences undermine the spirit of cooperation and friendly relations between the two neighboring countries.” - Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Jashim Uddin

This meeting reflects the ongoing challenges in Indo-Bangladesh relations, emphasizing the need for continued dialogue over border security issues.

item.title: Right is might: Jaishankar to attend Trump inauguration - The Times of India
item.description:
Jaishankar to Attend Trump Inauguration

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar is set to attend the inauguration of Donald Trump as the 45th president of the United States.

  • Jaishankar's attendance signifies the importance of Indo-U.S. relations.
  • He will represent India at a pivotal moment in international diplomacy.
  • The event underscores the ongoing collaboration between the two nations.
“Right is might,” Jaishankar stated regarding India’s stand on global issues.

The upcoming inauguration is expected to draw attention from various global leaders, reflecting the interconnectedness of international politics.

item.title: Lohri, Makar Sankranti Bank stock market holidays on 13, 14 January 2025? NSE, BSE open or closed? Trading off or not? Exchanges calendar 2025 - ET Now
item.description:
Understanding Stock Market Holidays on Lohri and Makar Sankranti in 2025

Updated: January 12, 2025 from ET Now

Lohri and Makar Sankranti, celebrated on January 13 and 14, 2025 respectively, will not result in trading holidays for BSE and NSE, which will remain open.

  • Lohri and Makar Sankranti fall on January 13 and 14, 2025, leading to inquiries about stock market operations.
  • BSE and NSE will be operational on both days without any declared trading holidays.
  • These festivals are celebrated across India, with different names and traditions.

“Lohri and Makar Sankranti are not included in the list of trading holidays in 2025,” emphasizing routine trading schedules.

Overall, the stock markets will function as usual during these festival dates, keeping trading hours unchanged.

item.title: Bangladesh summons Indian High Commissioner over rising border tensions - The Indian Express
item.description:
Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy Over Border Tensions

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Bangladesh faced off with India Sunday over tensions at the border as the neighbouring country’s foreign ministry summoned High Commissioner Pranay Verma to express “deep concern” over “recent activities of the Border Security Force (BSF)”.

This came hours after Dhaka alleged that India was attempting to construct fences at five locations along the Indo-Bangla border, violating a bilateral agreement.

After meeting Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Jashim Uddin, the Indian High Commissioner said: “I just met Foreign Secretary to discuss India’s commitment to ensuring a crime-free border, effectively addressing challenges of smuggling, movement of criminals and trafficking.” “We have an understanding with regard to fencing the border for security. BSF and BGB (Border Guard Bangladesh) have been in communication in this regard. We expect that understandings will be implemented and there will be a cooperative approach to combating crime,” Verma said in Dhaka.

Earlier in the day, Bangladesh Home Affairs Adviser Lt Gen (retd.) Jahangir Alam Chowdhury said that India had halted the construction of barbed wire fencing along the border after strong opposition from the BGB and local residents.

According to the Bangladesh Foreign Ministry, Jashim Uddin told the Indian envoy that the “unauthorized attempt” to construct fences and related operational actions by BSF have caused tensions along the border.

“He emphasised that the construction of barbed wire fences without proper authorization undermines the spirit of cooperation and friendly relations between the two neighboring countries. He hoped that the upcoming BGB-BSF DG Level Talks would be able to discuss the matter at length,” it said in a statement.

“Referring to the recent killing of a Bangladesh citizen at Sunamganj by BSF, Foreign Secretary… strongly resented these acts of killing and called for urgent action by the Indian authorities to stop recurrence of such incidents and conduct enquiries into all these border killings and take actions against those responsible,” it said.

He said Bangladesh believes such issues should be resolved through dialogue.

This article went live on January 12, 2025, at 6:06 PM.

item.title: "Nehru Became PM By Accident," Says Union Minister. Congress Leader Reacts - NDTV
item.description:
Nehru Became PM By Accident, Says Union Minister

Date: January 12, 2025   |   Source: Press Trust of India

During a gathering in Rohtak, Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar stated that Jawaharlal Nehru became India's first prime minister by accident, leading to criticism from Congress leader Bhupinder Hooda.

  • Khattar suggested that Sardar Vallabhai Patel and Dr. B.R. Ambedkar deserved the prime ministerial position over Nehru.
  • Hooda responded by calling Khattar an 'accidental chief minister' and criticized his comments.
  • Khattar emphasized the BJP's efforts to honor Dr. Ambedkar’s legacy, highlighting the establishment of places of respect associated with him.
  • The comments came in light of discussions regarding the memorial for former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh who recently passed away.
  • Khattar expressed confidence in the BJP's prospects for upcoming Assembly polls in Delhi.
“I want to say that Pandit JL Nehru became a prime minister by accident. In his place, someone who deserved it was Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and Dr BR Ambedkar.” — Manohar Lal Khattar

This statement reflects deep political sentiments as India approaches crucial elections.

item.title: GRAP 3 revoked in Delhi-NCR after dip in air pollution levels - The Hindu
item.description:
GRAP 3 Revoked in Delhi-NCR as Air Quality Improves

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: ANI

The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) lifted the ban on certain activities in Delhi-NCR due to improved air quality.

  • The CAQM revoked the restrictions on construction and demolition activities.
  • BS III petrol and BS IV diesel vehicles are now permitted.
  • The decision was influenced by a recent weather change, including rain and a western disturbance.
  • Stage-I and Stage-II restrictions remain in effect.
The Sub-Committee revoke its orders dated 09.01.2025, for invoking actions under Stage-III ('Severe' Air Quality) of the Schedule of GRAP (Revised December 2024), with immediate effect. — ANI (@ANI) January 12, 2025

The lifting of restrictions marks a positive change in air quality in the region.

item.title: 'Big mistake': BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht on party's decision to field Kapil Mishra from his seat - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht Criticizes Party's Decision on Kapil Mishra

Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a surprising statement, BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht expressed his concerns over the party's choice to field Kapil Mishra from his constituency, calling it a "big mistake" that could affect party dynamics.

  • BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht has critiqued the party's decision to nominate Kapil Mishra.
  • He termed this move a "big mistake," highlighting potential negative repercussions.
  • Bisht's comments could indicate tensions within the party ahead of upcoming elections.
"This decision may prove detrimental to our party's image and unity," he stated.

This internal dissent illustrates the ongoing challenges the BJP faces as it prepares for the electoral battle, suggesting possible fractures in party cohesion.

item.title: Re-designation of Asad Aijaz as Secretary to Government in J&K - Cross Town News
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: BPSC Row: Supporters Of Pappu Yadav Burn Tyres, Block Roads In Bihar - News18
item.description:
Protest Erupts in Bihar as Pappu Yadav's Supporters Demand BPSC Exam Cancellation

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: News18

Independent MP Pappu Yadav’s supporters protested in Patna, calling for the cancellation and re-examination of the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) exam.

  • Protesters burned tyres and blocked roads in a demonstration against the BPSC.
  • Pappu Yadav has called for a statewide 'Bihar Bandh' today.
  • This protest follows long-standing demands from aspirants regarding irregularities in the BPSC exam held on December 13, 2024.
“There is no strength bigger than people’s strength.” - Prashant Kishor

As tensions escalated, police detained some protesters. The ongoing protests reflect broader issues surrounding the integrity of the BPSC exams and the concerns raised by candidates.

item.title: Rahul Easwar moves Kerala High Court for anticipatory bail after actress warns of police complaint - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Rahul Easwar Moves Kerala High Court for Anticipatory Bail

Published on: 12 Jan 2025, 12:34 pm

Right wing activist and public commentator Rahul Easwar has sought anticipatory bail from the Kerala High Court following a warning from a Malayalam actress about a potential police complaint against him.

  • Easwar commented on the actress's clothing choices during media discussions about a recent sexual harassment case.
  • The actress claimed his remarks caused her significant mental anguish and threatened legal action.
  • Easwar's petition argues that his comments were intended as constructive criticism and not slander.
  • He is represented by advocates Alex K John, Ninan Thomas, Reena Jacob, and Gego George.
"It is submitted that the petitioner does not have any intention to slander the defacto complainant...the intention of the petitioner is only to give advice to the defacto complainant in the above said crime related to the dressing style of the defacto complainant".

This case highlights ongoing tensions surrounding public commentary on personal choices, especially in the context of sexual harassment allegations.

item.title: ‘People in Maharashtra showed Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray their place’: Amit Shah’s dig over poll results - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amit Shah Criticizes Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray After Maharashtra Poll Results

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Union Home Minister Amit Shah took a dig at Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray, stating that the recent Maharashtra assembly election results clearly showed them their place in the political landscape.

  • Shah emphasized that the results rejected the politics of dynasty and betrayal.
  • The BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a historic 233 seats in the assembly elections.
  • The Congress-led MVA won only 16 seats, while Thackeray's Shiv Sena secured 20 and Pawar’s NCP just 10.
“People in Maharashtra showed that Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena is Balasaheb's Shiv Sena.”

Shah expressed confidence in winning upcoming elections and remarked that the opposition's confidence has been shaken by the defeat in Maharashtra.

item.title: Delhi pollution: GRAP 3 revoked after air quality improves due to rainfall - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Pollution: Stage-I and Stage-II Measures, However, Will Remain in Effect

Date: Jan 12, 2025 07:20 PM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) revoked the Stage III restrictions under the anti-pollution Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR after the AQI improved due to rainfall.

  • The revocation was due to significant improvement in AQI, which dropped from 'very poor' to 'poor' following rain.
  • Stage-I and Stage-II measures will remain in effect, including restrictions on private construction.
  • The average AQI in Delhi was recorded at 284 post-rain on Sunday.
“The rain was caused by a western disturbance affecting northwest India,” said Mahesh Palawat, vice president at Skymet.

The rain has led to a temporary improvement in air quality, providing relief to residents.

item.title: Swapping trains at Katra will ensure safety: CM Omar Abdullah - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Safety Measures for Passengers at Katra Railway Station, Says CM Omar Abdullah

Date: January 12, 2023 | Source: Kashmir News Observer

Chief Minister Omar Abdullah emphasized the importance of passenger safety, supporting the practice of swapping trains at Katra railway station to address security concerns.

  • Omar Abdullah stated that security of passengers is a priority.
  • He believes people should accept train swapping at Katra if it enhances safety.
  • The Chief Minister discussed the ski slopes in Gulmarg and the potential for tourism in areas like Sonamarg.
  • He announced plans for a new convention center in Gulmarg to attract international events.
  • The long-awaited Z-Morh Tunnel will improve connectivity for local residents and travelers.
“At the end of the day, safety must come first,” said Omar Abdullah.

The Chief Minister's remarks highlight the ongoing efforts to ensure passenger safety while promoting tourism and infrastructure development in the region.

item.title: 'Victory in Maharashtra stopped betrayal politics of Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray': Amit Shah's big att - The Times of India
item.description:
Victory in Maharashtra stopped betrayal politics of Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray: Amit Shah's big attack on MVA

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Amit Shah delivered a pointed critique of the current Maharashtra government, asserting that their victory signifies a halt to the deceptive politics previously observed.

  • Shah claims the MVA alliance betrays public trust.
  • Highlights the need for accountability within Maharashtra's political framework.
  • Sets the stage for upcoming electoral challenges.
“Maharashtra has decided to reject betrayal politics,” said Amit Shah during his speech.

This statement marks a significant moment in the ongoing political narrative of Maharashtra as it addresses issues of integrity and public trust in leadership.

item.title: NEET PG 2024: MCC round 3 counselling deadline extended - The Indian Express
item.description:
NEET PG 2024: MCC round 3 counselling deadline extended

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has announced an extension for the choice filling and locking window for round three of NEET PG counselling, now set to end on January 16 by 8 am.

  • The final seat allotment list is scheduled for release on January 18.
  • Eligible candidates can register for PG medical colleges by January 15.
  • Reporting and joining at allotted colleges will occur between January 18 and January 25.
  • The cut-off percentile has been reduced, with new eligibility criteria for various categories in place.
“The general and EWS category students scoring 15 percentile and above will be eligible to participate in the counselling.”

The MCC's revised schedule aims to accommodate students impacted by the new percentile cut-offs.

item.title: Won’t contest Delhi election if Amit Shah withdraws cases against slum-dwellers: Kejriwal - The Tribune India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Delhi News Live Updates: Cong promises to give Rs 8,500 to educated unemployed youth for a year if voted to power in Delhi - The Indian Express
item.description:
Delhi News Live Updates: Cong promises to give Rs 8,500 to educated unemployed youth for a year if voted to power in Delhi

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

The Congress party has announced a financial aid of Rs 8,500 for every educated unemployed youth for one year under the ‘Yuva Udaan Yojana’ if they are elected in Delhi. This announcement precedes a campaign launch by Rahul Gandhi.

  • The financial aid is targeted to those who can demonstrate their skills to employers.
  • Sachin Pilot emphasized that this is not a scheme for passive income; support will be tied to employment opportunities.
  • Criticism from AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal against BJP regarding housing for slum residents.
“If you vote for BJP, then it will be like you signing on a suicide note.” - Arvind Kejriwal

This initiative aims to address youth unemployment in Delhi and stimulate job creation through engagement with local businesses.

item.title: Ramesh Bidhuri refutes AAP's 'BJP CM face' claim: 'Arvind Kejriwal accepted...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ramesh Bidhuri refutes AAP's 'BJP CM face' claim: 'Arvind Kejriwal accepted...'

Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Ramesh Bidhuri, the BJP candidate for the Kalkaji assembly seat, has rejected Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal's assertion that he would be the chief ministerial face of the BJP, calling it misleading propaganda.

  • Bidhuri emphasizes his loyalty to the BJP and clarity about not seeking any post.
  • Kejriwal’s claim implied that BJP would win the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.
  • Bidhuri mentions public dissatisfaction with Kejriwal’s governance, citing several scams and issues faced by the people of Delhi.
  • Kejriwal challenged Bidhuri to a public debate regarding his candidacy for CM.
  • The Delhi assembly election is scheduled for February 5, 2025, with results on February 8.
"The party has given me a lot, I have no claim for any post. Arvind Kejriwal has continuously started misleading propaganda against me." - Ramesh Bidhuri

In conclusion, Ramesh Bidhuri calls for support for the BJP, aiming to reassure the citizens of Delhi of his dedication and intent.

item.title: 'Baseless to refer me as BJP's CM face': Ramesh Bidhuri slams Arvind Kejriwal over 'misleading propaganda - The Times of India
item.description:
Baseless to refer me as BJP's CM face: Ramesh Bidhuri slams Arvind Kejriwal over misleading propaganda

Publication Date: [Date Not Available] Source: [Source Not Available]

Ramesh Bidhuri has publicly refuted claims made by Arvind Kejriwal, labeling them as misleading propaganda. Bidhuri stated that it is unfounded to refer to him as the BJP's Chief Ministerial candidate.

  • Bidhuri denies being the BJP's candidate for CM.
  • Accuses Kejriwal of spreading misleading information.
  • The political rivalry between BJP and AAP intensifies.
Bidhuri remarked, "It is baseless to refer to me in such a context."

Bidhuri's strong stance underscores the ongoing political tensions in the region.

item.title: On Swami Vivekananda’s birth anniversary, recalling how he introduced Hindu philosophies to the West - The Indian Express
item.description:
On Swami Vivekananda’s Birth Anniversary: His Impact on Hindu Philosophy in the West

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

On January 12, we celebrate the legacy of Swami Vivekananda, the influential Hindu spiritual leader known for introducing key Hindu philosophies to the West, particularly at the Chicago address in 1893. Prime Minister Modi honored him, noting his ongoing inspiration for youth.

  • Vivekananda was born as Narendra Nath Datta in Kolkata on January 12, 1863.
  • He became known for his impactful speech at the 1893 Parliament of the World’s Religions in Chicago.
  • His teachings emphasized universal acceptance and the value of Indian traditions.
  • He founded the Ramakrishna Mission in 1897 to promote spiritual knowledge and societal improvement.
  • His works, including 'Raja Yoga', 'Jnana Yoga', and 'Karma Yoga', popularized yoga and spirituality in the West.
“It may be that I shall find it good to get outside my body, to cast it off like a worn-out garment. But I shall not cease to work. I shall inspire men everywhere until the whole world shall know that it is one with God.” - Swami Vivekananda

Swami Vivekananda's teachings and efforts have significantly shaped the perception of Hinduism in the Western world, promoting a blend of spirituality and material progress that continues to resonate today.

item.title: ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates: In trial attempt at docking, SpaDeX satellites successfully come 3 meters to each other, says ISRO - The Indian Express
item.description:
ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates

Date: April 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In a recent trial attempt, the ISRO conducted a successful maneuver with its SpaDeX satellites, bringing them as close as 3 meters to one another. This experiment is a crucial step towards demonstrating in-space docking.

  • The SpaDeX mission aims to demonstrate in-space docking using small spacecraft.
  • If successful, India will become the fourth nation capable of this technology, joining the US, Russia, and China.
  • The mission is significant for future projects, including lunar missions and establishing a space station by 2035.
  • ISRO emphasizes caution due to the complexity of docking moving satellites.
“Since this is just a technology demonstration mission, getting it right is more important that getting it done on schedule.”

The SpaDeX mission is an important step for ISRO as it develops its capabilities for future space exploration endeavors.

item.title: 'Vivekananda said young generation will find solution to all problems, have absolute faith in him': PM Mo - The Times of India
item.description:
PM Modi Highlights Faith in Youth's Problem-Solving Abilities Inspired by Vivekananda

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Various news outlets

Prime Minister Modi emphasized that the younger generation possesses the capacity to tackle various challenges by drawing inspiration from Swami Vivekananda.

  • PM Modi expressed confidence in the youth's problem-solving skills.
  • He referenced Vivekananda's teachings as a guide for the younger generation.
  • The statement aims to inspire and encourage youth involvement in societal issues.
"Young generation will find solutions to all problems, have absolute faith in him."

This message serves to motivate the youth and highlight the importance of their role in shaping the future.

item.title: Developed nation is achievable with the strength of India’s youth: PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi Emphasizes Youth's Role in Achieving a Developed India

Date & Source: Jan 12, 2025, Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue 2025, emphasizing the critical role of India's youth in transforming the nation into a developed country over the next 25 years.

  • Modi highlighted Swami Vivekananda's faith in the potential of Indian youth.
  • The event marked National Youth Day and had 3,000 participants aged 15 to 29.
  • Modi shared anecdotes illustrating his trust in youth and their capabilities.
  • He mentioned the G-20 Summit and its significance for India's future.
  • A book titled 'Yuva Shakti’s Vision for Viksit Bharat @ 2047' was released during the event.
“I firmly believe that with the strength of India’s youth, the dream of a developed nation is achievable.” - PM Modi

In conclusion, Modi's optimism and vision for India's youth are pivotal in steering the nation towards development.

item.title: ‘Quite shocking’: Shashi Tharoor slams Nitesh Rane on EVM remark - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Quite shocking’: Shashi Tharoor slams Nitesh Rane on EVM remark

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Congress MP Shashi Tharoor condemned Maharashtra Minister Nitesh Rane's remarks about EVMs, calling them 'quite shocking' and emphasizing the need for equality and unity in India.

  • Tharoor reacted negatively to Rane's statement equating EVMs with anti-Muslim sentiment.
  • He highlighted the historical lessons from India's freedom struggle about religious equality.
  • Rane's comments drew criticism for targeting specific communities.
“This kind of thing is quite shocking... We are all equal individual citizens of India.” - Shashi Tharoor

Tharoor insists that the principles of equality must remain central to India's identity as a nation.

item.title: Torres fraud: Ukrainian masterminds fled India under garb of Christmas leave - The Indian Express
item.description:
Ukrainian Masterminds of Torres Fraud Scheme Escape on Christmas Leave

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Two Ukrainian women, suspected masterminds of a significant fraud case, fled India under the guise of taking Christmas leave, prompting an investigation by the Mumbai police Economic Offences Wing (EOW).

  • The women were identified as Victoriia Kovalenko and Olena Stoian, directors of Platinum Hern Pvt Ltd, which operates the Torres jewellery brand.
  • Three additional individuals were arrested in connection with the Torres Ponzi scheme, with a substantial amount of cash seized.
  • An internal conflict at the Torres Dadar store exposed financial irregularities that led to widespread investor concern, gathering about 600 investors outside the store.
  • Ongoing investigations are looking into possible connections to other fraud cases in Turkey.
“Internal fights exposed the collapse of the company,” said a source involved in the investigation.

This case underscores the risks in investment schemes and the need for due diligence among investors.

item.title: Military Digest | ‘Army is the servant of people…exists to defend democracy’: remembering General Cariappa’s legacy - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Army is the servant of people…exists to defend democracy’: remembering General Cariappa’s legacy

Publication Date: January 12, 2023 Source: Indian Express

This article commemorates Army Day and reflects on the legacy of General K M Cariappa, the first Indian general and commander-in-chief of the Indian Army. It highlights his emphasis on the army's role in defending democracy and serving the people.

  • Army Day is observed in memory of General K M Cariappa, who became commander-in-chief on January 15, 1949.
  • General Cariappa stated, “The Army is the servant of the people and it exists to defend democracy and protect…”
  • He advocated for discipline and moral integrity within the army as custodians of taxpayer-funded resources.
  • Introduced voluntary military training for civilians to instill a sense of discipline among the public.
  • The training proposal included physical training and sanitation talks but was not approved by the political establishment.
“Remember the Army, and everything in it, is the property of the taxpayer.” – General K M Cariappa

In conclusion, General Cariappa's vision for a disciplined army that serves the public remains relevant, although some of his training proposals faced political resistance.

item.title: In challenge to Amit Shah, Kejriwal says won’t contest Delhi polls if Centre assures houses for all slum-dwellers in court - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kejriwal Challenges Amit Shah Over Slum Housing in Delhi Elections

Date: January 12, 2025   Source: Indian Express

AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has stated that he will not contest the Delhi elections unless the central government drops cases against slum demolitions and assures housing for evicted slum-dwellers.

  • Kejriwal positioned himself as the protector of slum residents.
  • He criticized BJP for exploiting slum residents during elections.
  • Kejriwal warned that voting for BJP would lead to further slum demolitions.
  • He challenged Amit Shah to commit to housing slum dwellers.
  • Kejriwal reported only 4,000 houses built for 400,000 slum residents under the current scheme.
“If you vote for BJP, it will be like signing your own suicide note.”

Kejriwal emphasizes the need for government accountability regarding slum housing, stating his intentions to protect slum residents in the upcoming elections.

item.title: Jaishankar to represent India at Donald Trump’s swearing-in as US President - The Indian Express
item.description:
Jaishankar to Represent India at Donald Trump’s Swearing-in Ceremony

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Indian Express

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will attend Donald Trump’s swearing-in ceremony on January 20, as confirmed by the external affairs ministry.

  • Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the event.
  • The event is organized by the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee.
  • He will also hold meetings with members of the incoming administration and other dignitaries.
  • Jaishankar previously met NSA designate Mike Waltz during a visit in late December.
“EAM will also have meetings with representatives of the incoming Administration, as also some other dignitaries visiting the US on that occasion.”

This significant visit highlights India's diplomatic engagement with the United States and the importance of the upcoming administration.

item.title: Kerala Lottery Results 12.01.2025: Akshaya AK-685 Winners Declared; Full List Here! - News18
item.description:
Kerala Lottery Results Today: Here's FULL LIST of winning numbers for Akshaya AK-685 lucky draw for Sunday, January 12, 2025.

Last Updated: January 12, 2025, 21:28 IST

The Kerala State Lottery Department has announced the results for the Akshaya AK-685 lottery with significant prizes awarded. The first prize winner receives Rs 70 lakh, while second and third prizes are Rs 5 lakh and Rs 1 lakh, respectively. The winning numbers include:

  • First Prize: AB 846639 (Payyannur)
  • Second Prize: AH 243577 (Kottayam)
  • Third Prizes: AA 196854, AB 838400, AC 745225, AD 622450, AE 129668, AF 115526, AG 659827, AH 715095, AJ 303880, AK 692810, AL 579215, AM 889232.

Winning numbers for the consolation prize of Rs 8,000 are also listed. For those wishing to check their tickets, the results can be confirmed at www.keralalottery.info.
